data.title: Added a function to calculate acceleration to the MathHelper class
Make PackageFile.Scan case-insensitive on Windows
Remove WeakPtr's from object metrics container
data.body:
Use raw RefCounted pointers in metrics as WeakPtr can keep some instances "alive" for example in the ResourceCache

Closes #1471

data.title: Floating-point conversion independent from locale in StringUtils.cpp
data.body:
This is PR #1470 with some squashed commits and ```ATOMIC BEGIN/END``` modification blocks

Closes #710 (finally!)

data.title: [C#] Releasing a scene does not release resources owned by that scene
Make string to floating-point conversion independent from locale.
data.body:
Instead of using strtod() for converting strings to doubles, use strtod_l()
with an explicit "C" locale. The problem of strtod() is that the decimal
separator changes with the locale. So an XML written on an English system
cannot be read on a German system, for example.

Using strtod_l() + "C" locale uses a dot as separator all the time (locale-independent).

This finally fixes #1465 and #1469 for me (linux + German locale).

Could somebody test this on other platforms (Win, MacOS, ...) please?

data.title: XML-loading does not work in linux with German locale
data.body:
If a German locale is set in linux, loading from an XML file does not work. The problem is that in the XML files, a dot is used as decimal separator but the code for converting string to double (or string to float) in
`Source/AtomicGameEngine/Source/Atomic/Core/StringUtils.cpp` expects the localized separator (a comma for German). The ultimate problem is that `strtod` is used in `StringUtils.cpp`.

A mitigation could be to the same approach that rapidjson uses.

data.title: Add error scraper to Player Output window
data.body: This PR adds a Javascript error scraper to the Player Output window, which puts the magnifying glass next to an error filename + line number, and when clicked, brings the file up in the editor at the problem line.  The implementation is a little different than the TS version, the JS errors can repeat the same file+line, so only unique errors are captured. The same reference link is used by the magnifying glass widget for shared errors.

data.title: Small improvements in Thread class.
data.body:
- Make the helper functions to run the threaded function in the new thread static. This avoids
  exposing the symbol for the helper functions.
- Thread::GetCurrentThreadID() should not use pthread if ATOMIC_THREADING is undefined.

data.title: Update rapidjson to fix #710
data.body:
Update rapidjson to v1.1.0. This library version always uses '.' as decimal
separator instead of the separator selected by the current locale. This
should fix #710.

data.title: Black screen when running 2D platformer demo in linux
data.body: I have built the AGE from source on an Ubuntu 16.10 system. Running the 2D platformer demo results in an empty (black) window. Since there is a sound when jumping, I guess that something happens with the display output.

data.title: [Editor] Scene editor only shows part of the tiles in linux
data.body:
When opening the 2D platformer example under Ubuntu 16.10, the scene editor only shows a part of the scene. It appears as if the nodes are clipped against a circle with a wrong diameter. See the attached screenshot for an example.

![screenshot_20170308_210149](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4263348/23721673/f0633574-0442-11e7-84fe-b53ff12a0493.png)

data.title: Fixed index out-of-bounds bug.
data.body: Fixed bug #1462 in SceneSelection::GetSelectedNode().

data.title: [Editor] A typo in SceneSelection::GetSelectedNode()
Need user documentation, tutorials
data.body: The wiki is a fine start, but there needs to be a bootcamp or something to get users bridged from bringing up the editor to then running an example to see how things work.

data.title: [Events] Need a sendEvent override for sending an event to a specific node
data.body: In the event system, there is a way to subscribe to events only coming from a specific AObject.  There should also be some way to send an event only to a specific AObject.  This could be useful when you have multiple components hanging off a node and want to send some kind of message only to that node and have all the components attached be notified, but not affect other nodes which may have those same components attached.

data.title: [WINDOWS OPENGL] Fix for WebView on OpenGL on Windows
data.body: Fix for WebView on OpenGL on Windows (also fixes Monaco text editor on Windows WebGL which uses WebView).

data.title: Support .NET Core and Visual Studio Code in Linux
data.body: As talked about in [this Community Support thread](https://discourse.atomicgameengine.com/t/net-core-on-debian-jessie/174/5), it would be great if Atomic could support coding in C# with Visual Studio Code with .NET Core in Debian Jessie (and, of course, the other flavors of Linux that Atomic already supports).

data.title: [Android] Missing x86 support
data.body: When I tried to generate apk package, I found only armabi-v7a libraries in the generated APK file. It was both true for TypeScript and C# projects. It seems that the x86 android platform is not supported.

data.title: [TypeScript] Update internal editor to TS 2.2
data.body: 2.2 just dropped.  Probably want to wait about a week to make sure there isn't any updates to it, then pull it in.

data.title: Enable timer api in the editor
data.body: The opens up the editor to use the timer api and also adds definitions to the timer api to ```duktape.d.ts```.  Fixes #1454

data.title: Add AtomicEventLoop to AtomicEditor
data.body: The AtomicEventLoop is needed in the AtomicEditor to get access to the setInterval and setTimeout javascript functions.

data.title: Add missing DiffAlphaMask.xml
data.body: This has been showing up as an error when running a project for a while, it was indeed missing, this PR adds it in.

data.title: [Windows] OpenGL build needs fixes to WebView preprocessor defines for WebTexture

data.body: There are a number of preprocessor guards here for D3D9, D3D11, OpenGL: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/AtomicWebView/WebTexture2D.cpp#L116

data.title: TypeScript and Extension fixes
data.body:
This is just a combination of small changes that I discovered while trying to put together a tutorial for creating a menu extension.
- Updated the service locator sendEvent method signature to use the new event system
- Changed the extensions to all descend from Atomic.ScriptObject so that they can be event listeners/senders (which effectively deprecates the sendEvent method in the service locator)
- Modified the extension loader to clear any previously loaded extensions from the ```require``` cache when closing and re-opening a project.  Otherwise it was not loading the changes and required you to exit the editor entirely.
- fix for not trying to compile previously transpiled js files.  JS files will only be put into the TS transpiler if they are true js files and not transpiled from ts.
- Send notifications to the status bar when transpiling typescript. Thanks @JimMarlowe!  
- modified the output of the TS transpiler so that it looks good in both dark theme and light theme.
- fixed an issue where clicking an error in the transpiled output wouldn't always navigate to the line in the editor
- fixed an issue where the file extension was not automatically being appended to a new file if the filename had dots in it.

data.title: Add screenshot function
data.body:
This PR add the function to save screenshots of the editor.
There is a preference for the screenshot path.
There is a preference for the save format : png, jpg, bmp, tga, dds
The image is saved with an autogenerated name : Screenshot_dd_mm_yyy_HH_MM_SS.ext
The screenshot is invoked with either the menu entry in Developer->Screenshot, or the key combo, Ctrl+9

Sorry, but this breaks the 35 additions chain... so talk to these ladies...
![screenshot_16_02_2017_19_10_19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19511757/23051980/23617452-f482-11e6-86e9-02321e1b22c1.png)

data.title: How to make a Javascript Editor plugin
data.body:
I would to know how to make a JS Editor plugin (TS, if it has to be).  I want to add a button in an Editor menu that executes a JS function, and then how to make the Editor use it.
Yes, there is an example "EditorPlugins" which does something, but there is no information on what it is or how to use it.

data.title: Add thumbnail tooltip
data.body:
This PR adds a thumbnail (image) tooltip. It will automagically provide the thumbnail tooltip for .png, .jpg assets in a project's Texture directory.  There is also support for using thumbnails for .prefab, .mdl and .fbx assets.   To add a thumbnail for an asset is "easy". The user can create a new directory in the project root directory (where Resources and Cache are) called Support.   A (png) thumbnail for an asset is named assetname.ext.png, where assetname.ext is what you would see in the Project browser. Then, when you hover over assetname.ext, the thumbnail tooltip will appear. If no thumbnail is created for the asset, then nothing will appear.
Normal text tooltips are unaffected, for a thumbail tooltip, the 1st character in the string is a  "#" character, followed by a pathname to the image to display. The Texture based images in the project will show the actual image files, as defined by the asset. The other type assets are redirected to the Support directory to look for custom thumbnail images.
The reason the Project/Support directory is selected to hold the thumbnails, is so they dont effect the asset system, they are not needed for deploying the game, but they are relevant to the project.

OH NO 35 lines again!

data.title: Support for Chromium WebView on Direct3D11
data.body: Adds support for WebView under Direct3D 11

data.title: Add statusbar to AtomicEditor
data.body:
This PR adds a status bar to the AtomicEditor. It displays text at the bottom of the tool, and uses a timer to remove the text after 10 seconds to avoid having stale text being displayed. The feature can be accessed from inside the editor code with the API  EditorUI.showEditorStatus( "I am a status message" );
or by using an event like : this.sendEvent(Editor.EditorModalEventData({ type: Editor.EDITOR_MODALINFO, title: "", message: "I am a status message" }));
